title: Mathematics Education Instructional Design Through Intergenerational Interaction

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge and fundamental educational concepts
context.additional_context: Mixed-methods interactive learning environment where pre-service teachers collaborate with elderly populations to develop mathematics pedagogy.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the mathematical experiences and everyday problem-solving methods of older adults through intergenerational collaboration activities.
Learners can design two or more tools to evaluate the educational effects of intergenerational interaction using mixed research methods (quantitative + qualitative).
Learners can improve empathic communication skills by conducting weekly mathematical dialogue sessions with elderly partners over 18 weeks.

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (Video Conferencing System, Real-Time Document Editor)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
